titlestmt.titleproper: Jean S. Straub collection of research materials related to the William Penn Charter School 1957-1988 1960-1970
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Jean S. Straub collection of research materials related to the William Penn Charter School

bioghist.p: Jean S. Straub (1920-1999) served on the faculties of the University of Pennsylvania and the Ohio State University. She wrote on Pennsylvania history and Quaker education. She is the author of "Quaker School Life in Philadelphia Before 1800" and "Teaching in the Friends' Latin School of Philadelphia in the Eighteenth Century." She researched the William Penn Charter School for a book entitled "Good Education for Youth," but the book was never published.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of research notes for and drafts of Jean Straub's history of the William Penn Charter School. The collection also includes copies of her published articles on education and correspondence with editors regarding these articles and her proposed history of the school.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Haverford College: William Penn Charter School Archives (collection # 1115).
